articles.title: One shot, seven days: Long-acting levodopa gel tackles Parkinson’s tremors - ScienceDaily
articles.description: Researchers in Australia have created a biodegradable gel that delivers Parkinson’s medications through a single weekly shot, replacing the need for multiple daily pills. Injected just under the skin, the gel steadily releases levodopa and carbidopa for seven…
articles.content: A new weekly injectable drug could transform the lives of more than eight million people living with Parkinson's disease, potentially replacing the need for multiple daily tablets.Scientists from the… [+3315 chars]
